plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: An evergreen perennial known for its large, fragrant white flowers that often appear in late winter, sometimes pushing through snow. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe.
plants.funFact: Despite the common name, Christmas Rose often blooms in late winter and was historically prized for bringing color to gardens during cold months.

plants.name: Crocus tommasinianus
plants.description: A small perennial bulb that naturalizes easily in lawns and woodlands. Its pale purple flowers are among the first crocuses to bloom, often signaling the approaching spring.
plants.funFact: Early Crocus flowers close at night and reopen with the sunlight, an adaptation to protect pollen.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing evergreen tree or shrub with silvery foliage and bright yellow, fragrant, fluffy flower clusters. It thrives in Mediterranean climates and is often appreciated for winter and early spring blooms.
plants.location: Australia; cultivated in Mediterranean climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Silver Wattle's bright yellow flowers were traditionally used in Europe to celebrate International Women's Day on March 8.

plants.name: Magnolia × soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid deciduous tree with large, tulip-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It blooms early in spring, often before leaf-out, creating a spectacular floral display.
plants.location: Cultivated widely in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Saucer Magnolia was developed in France in the early 19th century and is one of the most popular magnolias in temperate gardens.
